author: Special Correspondent
text:
:The ruling All India NR Congress (AINRC) MLA P.Angalane is likely to join the Congress party in the presence of senior Congress leaders in Madhagadipet on Wednesday.

The three-time MLA resigned last week from the party primary membership, alleging that the party president and Chief Minister N. Rangasamy deliberately ignored his constituency. However, he has not resigned the MLA post yet.

Mr. Angalane represents the Thirubuvanai constituency in the Legislative Assembly and was secretary of the AINRC.

Mr. Angalane confirmed that he is going to join Congress party on Wednesday.

He began his political career with Congress party at initial stage and was as a candidate in 2001 in Thirubuvanai (Reserved) Constituency and got elected to the Legislative Assembly first.

In 2006, he was elected as an MLA from the same constituency and was a Social Welfare Minister for six months during the Congress regime when N.Rangasamy was the Chief Minister.

Mr. Angalane was given the post of party secretary by Mr. Rangasamy when he launched the AINRC
title: Angalane likely to join Congress today
